meanings.definition: To resign or give up a position or office.
meanings.sent1: She demitted her role as team captain.
meanings.sent2: He demitted his duties as mayor.
meanings.sent3: The cat demitted its title as ruler of the house to the new kitten.
meanings.sent4: The sun demitted its reign to the moon as night fell.
meanings.sent5: The student demitted his seat at the front of the class to the new student.

meanings.definition: To transfer or hand over possession of something.
meanings.sent1: He demitted the keys to the new owner.
meanings.sent2: She demitted the responsibility to her colleague.
meanings.sent3: The tree demitted its leaves to welcome the new season.
meanings.sent4: The chef demitted the kitchen to the sous chef for the evening.
meanings.sent5: The teacher demitted the classroom to the substitute teacher.

meanings.definition: To convey or transmit information or knowledge.
meanings.sent1: The professor demitted the lecture to the students.
meanings.sent2: She demitted the news of the upcoming event.
meanings.sent3: The bird demitted its song to the early morning air.
meanings.sent4: The radio demitted the latest weather report to the listeners.
meanings.sent5: The book demitted its secrets to the curious reader.
